input: Analyze real-time delivery fleet data to optimize vehicle parameters within safety guidelines, track operational results continuously, and report performance improvements to stakeholders.

inputs.name: R
inputs.source_origin: IoT platform/fleet management API (e.g., Samsara, Geotab)
inputs.input_data: GPS coordinates, speed, fuel consumption, engine diagnostics, location timestamps

inputs.name: S
inputs.input_data: Maximum speed thresholds, maintenance intervals, driver hour regulations

inputs.name: H
inputs.input_data: Past fuel efficiency metrics, average delivery times, maintenance cost history

inputs.name: S
inputs.input_data: Report structure, KPI visualization requirements, distribution list

steps:
Uses: Real-time Vehicle Sensor Data, Safety Guidelines
Action: Validate sensor data against safety thresholds to identify constraint violations
Produces: Constraint Violation Log
Stores/Sends To: Monitoring database

Uses: Historical Performance Benchmarks, Real-time Vehicle Sensor Data
Action: Calculate current efficiency metrics (MPG, deliveries/hour) vs historical averages
Produces: Performance Delta Analysis
Stores/Sends To: Analytics database

Uses: Safety Guidelines, Performance Delta Analysis
Action: Generate optimization model with safety constraints and efficiency targets
Produces: Optimization Model Configuration
Stores/Sends To: Optimization engine

Uses: Real-time Vehicle Sensor Data, Optimization Model Configuration
Action: Run real-time optimization algorithm to calculate parameter adjustments
Produces: Optimized Vehicle Parameters
Stores/Sends To: Fleet management system API

Uses: Fleet Management System Access, Optimized Vehicle Parameters
Action: Deploy parameter updates to vehicle ECUs through secure API connection
Produces: Vehicle Configuration Update Confirmation
Stores/Sends To: Vehicle systems

Uses: Real-time Vehicle Sensor Data, Historical Performance Benchmarks
Action: Continuously calculate moving average efficiency metrics vs baselines
Produces: Operational Performance Metrics
Stores/Sends To: Executive dashboard

Uses: Stakeholder Report Template, Operational Performance Metrics
Action: Populate report template with current metrics and trend analysis
Produces: Stakeholder Performance Report
Stores/Sends To: Email distribution system

DERIVABLE Input Chains:
1. Optimized Vehicle Parameters

2. Operational Performance Metrics
Source Type: DERIVABLE
Source Origin: Analytics engine
Input Data: Calculated efficiency deltas, compliance scores
Bound Reference: Step 6 output
execution_plan.raw_response:
Inputs:
1. Real-time Vehicle Sensor Data
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE
   Source Origin: IoT platform/fleet management API (e.g., Samsara, Geotab)
   Input Data: GPS coordinates, speed, fuel consumption, engine diagnostics, location timestamps
   Bound Reference: [DEPTH STOP - Terminal input]

2. Safety Guidelines
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED
   Source Origin: Fleet operations team
   Input Data: Maximum speed thresholds, maintenance intervals, driver hour regulations
   Note: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.

3. Historical Performance Benchmarks
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE
   Source Origin: Fleet analytics database
   Input Data: Past fuel efficiency metrics, average delivery times, maintenance cost history
   Bound Reference: [DEPTH STOP - Terminal input]

4. Stakeholder Report Template
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED
   Source Origin: Executive team
   Input Data: Report structure, KPI visualization requirements, distribution list
   Note: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.

5. Fleet Management System Access
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE
   Source Origin: Internal IT infrastructure
   Input Data: API credentials for parameter adjustment
   Bound Reference: [DEPTH STOP - Terminal input]

Outputs:
1. Optimized Vehicle Parameters
   Type: Persisted state changes
   Description: Adjusted speed governors, route optimization settings, maintenance alerts

2. Operational Performance Metrics
   Type: Measurable reports
   Description: Real-time efficiency dashboard showing fuel savings, delivery time improvements

3. Stakeholder Performance Report
   Type: Observable artifact
   Description: PDF/HTML document showing KPI improvements vs benchmarks, sent to distribution list

Steps:
Step 1:
Uses: Real-time Vehicle Sensor Data, Safety Guidelines
Action: Validate sensor data against safety thresholds to identify constraint violations
Produces: Constraint Violation Log
Stores/Sends To: Monitoring database

Step 2:
Uses: Historical Performance Benchmarks, Real-time Vehicle Sensor Data
Action: Calculate current efficiency metrics (MPG, deliveries/hour) vs historical averages
Produces: Performance Delta Analysis
Stores/Sends To: Analytics database

Step 3:
Uses: Safety Guidelines, Performance Delta Analysis
Action: Generate optimization model with safety constraints and efficiency targets
Produces: Optimization Model Configuration
Stores/Sends To: Optimization engine

Step 4:
Uses: Real-time Vehicle Sensor Data, Optimization Model Configuration
Action: Run real-time optimization algorithm to calculate parameter adjustments
Produces: Optimized Vehicle Parameters
Stores/Sends To: Fleet management system API

Step 5:
Uses: Fleet Management System Access, Optimized Vehicle Parameters
Action: Deploy parameter updates to vehicle ECUs through secure API connection
Produces: Vehicle Configuration Update Confirmation
Stores/Sends To: Vehicle systems

Step 6:
Uses: Real-time Vehicle Sensor Data, Historical Performance Benchmarks
Action: Continuously calculate moving average efficiency metrics vs baselines
Produces: Operational Performance Metrics
Stores/Sends To: Executive dashboard

Step 7:
Uses: Stakeholder Report Template, Operational Performance Metrics
Action: Populate report template with current metrics and trend analysis
Produces: Stakeholder Performance Report
Stores/Sends To: Email distribution system

DERIVABLE Input Chains:
1. Optimized Vehicle Parameters
   Source Type: DERIVABLE
   Source Origin: Optimization algorithm output
   Input Data: Calculated speed governors, route parameters, maintenance triggers
   Bound Reference: Step 4 output
   Note: [DEPTH STOP - Terminal input]

2. Operational Performance Metrics
   Source Type: DERIVABLE
   Source Origin: Analytics engine
   Input Data: Calculated efficiency deltas, compliance scores
   Bound Reference: Step 6 output
   Note: [DEPTH STOP - Terminal input]

aeb_analysis.aeb_analysis_raw:
### AEB Analysis for Each Step

---

#### **Step 1**  
- **Step:** Validate sensor data against safety thresholds to identify constraint violations  
- **Is AEB:** No  
- **Reason:** This step involves **validation**, which is explicitly prohibited in AEBs. Validation inherently includes **branching logic** (e.g., "if data exceeds threshold, log violation").  
- **Suggestion:** Break into two steps:  
  1. **Read sensor data** (AEB: Yes – single intent, no branching).  
  2. **Check data against safety thresholds** (AEB: No – still involves validation; further break into a separate AEB for logging violations if thresholds are exceeded).  

---

#### **Step 2**  
- **Step:** Calculate current efficiency metrics (MPG, deliveries/hour) vs historical averages  
- **Is AEB:** Yes  
- **Reason:** This is a **single intent** (calculate metrics), involves **no branching or sequencing**, and can be implemented as a single function/API call. It interacts with one system boundary (Analytics database).  

---

#### **Step 3**  
- **Step:** Generate optimization model with safety constraints and efficiency targets  
- **Is AEB:** Yes  
- **Reason:** The action has a **single intent** (generate a model), uses two inputs, and produces a single output. If implemented as a single API call to an optimization engine, it qualifies as an AEB.  

---

#### **Step 4**  
- **Step:** Run real-time optimization algorithm to calculate parameter adjustments  
- **Is AEB:** Yes  
- **Reason:** This is a **directly executable action** (run an algorithm), has **single intent**, and interacts with one system boundary (Fleet management system). It can be implemented as a single function call.  

---

#### **Step 5**  
- **Step:** Deploy parameter updates to vehicle ECUs through secure API connection  
- **Is AEB:** Yes  
- **Reason:** This is a **single API call** to deploy updates, with **no branching or sequencing**. It interacts with one system boundary (Vehicle systems).  

---

#### **
